article_metadata.news-keywords: William , Barber, Jonathan, Wilson, Hartgrove, NAACP, belhaven, hospital, Pungo, vidant, Portia, Gibbs, walk, Washington, DC, health, care, Medicaid, expansion, politics, NC, North Carolina
article_metadata.description: William J. Barber II and Jonathan Wilson-Hartgrove: Portia Gibbs of Belhaven died because of the political extremism that led to no Medicaid expansion. If something does not change in state capitols and corporate boardrooms throughout this country, thousands more like her will die this year.
article_metadata.title: A walk from NC to DC to mark our moral crisis | News & Observer
